articles.headline: 2 Valeant Dermatology Drugs Lead Steep Price Increases, Study Finds
articles.snippet: The study found that prices for 19 brand-name dermatology drugs increased about 400 percent in the last six years, but two of Valeant’s increases were the biggest.
articles.abstract: The study found that prices for 19 brand-name dermatology drugs increased about 400 percent in the last six years, but two of Valeant’s increases were the biggest.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two drugs sold by Valeant Pharmaceuticals International to treat cancer-related skin conditions increased in price by about 1,700 percent over the last six years, according to a newly published survey that found big increases in the cost of dermatology drugs across the board.

articles.headline: Ousted Founder of Men’s Wearhouse Watches His Old Company Struggle
articles.snippet: Two years ago, George Zimmer was pushed out of the company closely associated with his face. Now its stock is suffering, while he has started two online businesses.
articles.abstract: Two years ago, George Zimmer was pushed out of the company closely associated with his face. Now its stock is suffering, while he has started two online businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: When George Zimmer, founder and public face of the retail chain Men’s Wearhouse — “You’re going to like the way you look. I guarantee it.” — was fired two years ago by his handpicked board, there was no sugarcoating the message.

articles.headline: Black Friday Deal or Dud? How to Shop Smart This Holiday Season
articles.snippet: Only a small fraction of Black Friday discounts are true bargains, according to the editor of The Wirecutter, a product recommendation site. But there’s a way to check which purchases are worthwhile.
articles.abstract: Only a small fraction of Black Friday discounts are true bargains, according to the editor of The Wirecutter, a product recommendation site. But there’s a way to check which purchases are worthwhile.
articles.lead_paragraph: Before lining up at a retail store or firing up your computer for Black Friday bargains this week, ask yourself one question: Have you ever scored a great deal from the annual post-Thanksgiving shopping bonanza?

articles.headline: As Mayor, Bernie Sanders Was More Pragmatist Than Socialist
articles.snippet: Bernie Sanders, who in the 1980s was mayor of Vermont’s largest city, Burlington, tended to talk globally but act locally, aligning with Republicans to get things done.
articles.abstract: Bernie Sanders, who in the 1980s was mayor of Vermont’s largest city, Burlington, tended to talk globally but act locally, aligning with Republicans to get things done.
articles.lead_paragraph: BURLINGTON, Vt. — When Bernie Sanders, a self-declared socialist, served as mayor here in the 1980s, he often complained that the United States had its priorities wrong, that it should be diverting money from the military to domestic needs like housing and health care.

articles.headline: Black Friday Falters as Consumer Behaviors Change
articles.snippet: The decline in impact of the day after Thanksgiving suggests a shift in the way consumers spend. They’re going online more, and buying furnishings instead of sweaters.
articles.abstract: The decline in impact of the day after Thanksgiving suggests a shift in the way consumers spend. They’re going online more, and buying furnishings instead of sweaters.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 1939, the nation’s largest retailers sent Franklin D. Roosevelt an urgent plea. Thanksgiving fell on the last day of November that year, giving merchants too few days before Christmas to unleash the season’s sales.
articles.byline: By Hiroko Tabuchi and Nelson D. Schwartz

articles.headline: Court Filing Challenges Competence of Sumner Redstone
articles.snippet: The filing in a California court was made by Manuela Herzer, a friend of Mr. Redstone, 92, who has controlling interests in CBS and Viacom.
articles.abstract: The filing in a California court was made by Manuela Herzer, a friend of Mr. Redstone, 92, who has controlling interests in CBS and Viacom.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — A former companion of the ailing media mogul Sumner M. Redstone, executive chairman of Viacom and CBS, challenged his mental competence on Wednesday in a detailed filing with the Los Angeles County Superior Court.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Despite Global Events, U.S. Gasoline Prices Remain Low
articles.snippet: Prices for the Thanksgiving weekend are at their lowest since 2008 despite tensions in the Middle East and terrorist attacks.
articles.abstract: Prices for the Thanksgiving weekend are at their lowest since 2008 despite tensions in the Middle East and terrorist attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — American travelers are being treated to bargains at the gasoline pump this Thanksgiving weekend. Prices are at their lowest level for the holiday since the financial crisis of 2008 despite heightened tensions in the Middle East and a spate of terrorist attacks that would normally lead to higher prices.

articles.headline: Paris Attacks Have Many in France Eager to Join the Fight
articles.snippet: The nation is showing its patriotic fervor after the ISIS killings, from a jump in sales of French flags to a surge in enlistment applications.
articles.abstract: The nation is showing its patriotic fervor after the ISIS killings, from a jump in sales of French flags to a surge in enlistment applications.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The attacks by militants tied to the Islamic State less than two weeks ago in Paris have awakened a patriotic fervor in France not seen in decades.
